AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.certificate of appealability: document required for an appeal to proceed under the Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996, which will not issue unless the petitioner makes a substantial showing of the denial of a constitutional right
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Nancy F. Atlas: judge who concludes that jurists of reason would not debate whether the movant has stated a valid claim or whether any procedural ruling in this case was correct, resulting in the denial of a certificate of appealability
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Federal Grand Jury: grand jury that may deny a certificate of appealability, sua sponte, without requiring further briefing or argument
